title: Costco Stock Dropped After Its Earnings Release. Now Its Rising and Analysts Are Upbeat.
text:
Text size

Costco Wholesale stock, which had edged down in premarket trading Friday, were moving higher after Wall Street analysts defended the retailer’s fiscal fourth-quarter report.

Costco stock (ticker: COST) has climbed more than 40% in 2019, well ahead of the S&P 500’s 16% gain. The company has won praise for a string of good sales reports, its overseas expansion plans, competitive positioning in the grocery space, and strong management. (Barron’s named Costco’s CEO one of the world’s best this spring). Valuation remains a concern, although it doesn’t bother bulls who point to Costco’s continued success.

Returns like that, however, can raise expectations to the point where even a small miss on, say, sales, can be too much. And that was the case for Costco. Late Thursday, Costco reported fourth-quarter results, saying it earned $2.69 a share on revenue of $47.5 billion in its fourth quarter, while analysts were looking for EPS of $2.55 and revenue of $47.7 billion. (The company’s bottom line excluded a 22 cents per-share tax assessment.) Comparable sales rose 5.1% in the quarter: U.S. same-store sales climbed 6.1%, while online sales were up 19.8%.

Costco stock dropped 1.3% in after-hours trading following the release but was up 0.7% to $291.04 at 11:42 a.m. Friday. The S&P 500 was up 0.9% at 2936.50, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average had gained 225.29 points, or 0.9%, to 26,426.33.

Maybe it has something to do with the analyst reaction? While the market appeared to be disappointed early on, they found plenty to like about the quarter.

Cowen & Co.’s Oliver Chen kept his Outperform rating and $325 price target intact. “We continue to believe COST is better positioned to handle dislocation in a rising tariff environment with recession risk,” he wrote in a research note.

Gordon Haskett’s Chuck Grom reiterated an Accumulate rating and $330 price target, writing that “ with renewal rates at all time highs, favorable gross profit margin performance, and continued strong top-line momentum on its side, we continue to view Costco as a core holding.”

Stifel’s Mark Astrachan has a Buy rating and $310 price target on the shares. “Overall we view the result as solid and reflective of Costco’s continued focus on improving the customer value proposition to drive sales growth which increases earnings flexibility,” he said.

Telsey Advisory Group’s Joseph Feldman reiterated an Outperform rating and raised his price target by $10 to $315 following the report. “Costco is operating at a high level, and better than most in retail,” he wrote. “We continue to expect Costco to remain a share gainer, with its solid sales and traffic trends, high membership renewal rates, and square footage growth of low-single digits.”

Jefferies’ Christopher Mandeville is one of the few analysts with a Hold rating on Costco stock but even he found something to like. “Renewal rates have reached all-time highs and the Costco brand is resonating w/ consumers domestically and abroad,” he writes. Concerns about tariffs and valuation keep him on the sidelines.

Write to Teresa Rivas at teresa.rivas@barrons.com
description: The giant retailer released its results for its fiscal fourth quarter late on Thursday.
